channel.title: Question about space? (client.java)
channel.description:
ive been wodering this for awhile when people say their client.java is at 600 somthing kb do they mean the size on disk or the size? also they say the lower your client.java is the less lag you have? is that true i know its a nooby question but owell
my client.java is size: [b]933 KB (955,699 bytes)[/b] size on disk: [b]336 KB (344,064 bytes)[/b]
would that be good? ive also heard having alot of handlers makes your server lag?

item.title: Question about space? (client.java)
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

eclipse245:

No…handlers make your server less laggy…But usually everything under public boolean process is what makes your server lag, so the more you have their, the more RAM will be required

k thanks lol
edit: do you think thats a reasonable size for my client.java?

Read full topic
